carpooling_package

Class searchRoute

  • java.lang.Object
    • carpooling_package.searchRoute

  • public class searchRoute
extends java.lang.Object
    A Class that allows user to search for available routes.

    • Method Detail

      • Search

        public static int Search(Car[] car)
                  throws InvalidDataException,
                         java.util.InputMismatchException
        Searches whether by Route Number or writing route searching for.
        Parameters:
        car - Array of cars to search for the routes available.
        Returns:
        Route Number of route wanted.
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if string is entered instead of integer.
        InvalidDataException - if entered an invalid choice which is not [1] or [2].
        See Also:
        searchByRouteName(carpooling_package.Car[]), searchByRouteNumber(carpooling_package.Car[]), Input Mismatch Exception Reference

      • searchByRouteName

        public private static int searchByRouteName(Car[] car)
                                     throws InvalidDataException
        Searches for a Route by route name and if not found call search by Route number method.
        Parameters:
        car - array of cars to search for routes.
        Returns:
        route number of the desired route.
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - if invalid entry occurred.
        See Also:
        searchByRouteNumber(carpooling_package.Car[]), Car

      • searchByRouteNumber

        public private static int searchByRouteNumber(Car[] car)
                                       throws InvalidDataException,
                                              java.util.InputMismatchException,
                                              java.lang.NullPointerException
        Displays all Routes available and Searches for a Route by route number.
        Parameters:
        car - array of cars to search for routes.
        Returns:
        route number of the desired route.
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if string is entered instead of integer.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if try to access a route number out of range available.
        InvalidDataException - if entered a negative route number or number 0.
        See Also:
        Car, Input Mismatch Exception Reference , Null Pointer Exception Reference
